title: ICE when passing `()` to a function generic over `Copy`

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
```rust
#![feature(core_intrinsics)]
extern crate core;
use core::intrinsics;

fn write_reg<T: Copy>(reg: u32, val: T) {
    unsafe { intrinsics::volatile_store(reg as *mut T, val); }
}

fn main() {
    write_reg(0x10000000, ());
}
```

I was met with an internal compiler error:
`error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic`

I expected some kind of user-comprehensible error, instead.

## Meta

Rust version: `rustc 1.19.0-nightly (01951a61a 2017-05-20)`

Associated Rust Playground: https://is.gd/ZHy4Av

Backtrace:

